results.title: Merlin's magical message
results.creator_credit: American Dental Association and Rick Reinert
results.brief_description: Uses animation to emphasise he importance of home dental care in preserving good dental health. Using animation and Merlins and King Arthur as characters, pints out the importance of home dental care, especially brushing.

results.title: Merlin
results.brief_description: Marvel at the magic of Merlin in this spectacular presentation. Sorceress Mab (Miranda Richardson), summons forth the wizard Merlin (Sam Neill) in an attempt to perpetuate the powers of old. Her surrogate son loses her passion for dark magic when his heart is touched by love in the form of the beautiful Nimue (Isabella Rossellini). Merlin aligns himself with the warrior who will become King Arthur and is able to use his powers for good to bring peace and justice. Wherever there is good however, evil lurks, and a battle is waged between these two opposing forces. Even if you are not a fan of fantasy, the special effects from Framestore and Jim Henson’s Creature shop, as well as the costuming will delight the visual senses. Also starring Helena Bonham Carter, John Gielgud, Rutger Hauer, Martin Short and James Earl Jones. The feature presentation is followed by “The Magical making of Merlin” produced by Russ Patrick.

results.title: Merely Mr. Hawkins
results.creator_credit: Carlyle Pictures, George Smith and Maclean Rogers
results.brief_description: A light British comedy about the daughter of a small town bank clerk coming into an inheritance which makes her life the target for a charming con-man, who fools her and her shrewish mother into believing him to be a Canadian millionaire. Flighty eventuality ensues.

results.title: Mercury rising
results.creator_credit: Universal City Studios Productions, Brian Grazer, Karen Kehela and Harold Becker
results.brief_description: Simon (Miko Hughes), a nine year old autistic boy cracks a code that has a lot of people worried - MERCURY, the most advanced (and expensive) encryption code the U.S government has. Simon comes across the enigma hidden in a puzzle magazine (an orchestrated move by the NSA who designed MERCURY and wanted to test their brainchild out on real people), and when he calls for the prize triggers an alarm at the National Security Agency. NSA Chief Nicholas Kudrow (Alec Baldwin) hires an assassin to kill Simon, believing this is the only way to stop the threat to national security. The only hope Simon has for survival lies with renegade FBI agent Art Jeffries (Bruce Willis), a man willing to protect the emotionally unpredictable child who has no-one else to turn to when ruthless Federal agents are out to get him. The task will take Jeffries muscle power and Simon’s special ability to be successful. Based on the novel “Simple Simon” by Ryne Douglas Pearson. Cast also includes Chi McBride and Kim Dickens.

results.title: Mephisto [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ma Film, Manfred Durniok and Istvan Szabo
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Klaus Mann, “Mephisto” is the story of one man’s struggle between his art and his morality. Set in Germany of the 1930s, “Mephisto” plots the rise of provincial actor Hendrik Hoefgen (Klaus Maria Brandauer) and the simultaneous rise of Nazism in Europe. Hoefgan is a talented, if vain actor who is not above flattery and manipulation of those around him to achieve his ambitious ends. A man who once had left wing political leanings, Hoefgen is forced to renounce his personal politics and even betray former colleagues in order to gain favour with the Nazis and advance his career. “Mephisto” is a compelling portrait of an artist whose ambition is in conflict with his integrity. The mood and aesthetics of 1930s Berlin are aptly evoked in this award winning drama (Oscar for Best Foreign Film, 1982). Directed by Istran Durnoik (Sunshine, Meeting Venus) and also starring Krystyna Janda and Ildiko Bansagi.

results.title: Meow meow
results.creator_credit: Yellow Ball Workshop, Ruckus Films, Dominic Falcone, Red Grooms and Yvonne Anderson
results.brief_description: A man and his pet lion. The lion overthrows a kidnapper and becomes a celebrity of New York City, type of city. he stars in a musical, is eventually kidnapped himself, is saved by a black bartender and eats the kidnappers. Totally wild, over the top, visually very colourful and fun animation.

results.title: Meo Village: Family life
results.brief_description: Shows the life style of people in one particular Meo village in Thailand. Stresses the Meo concept of the extended family with the grandparents and other relatives living under the same roof and explains the interdependence of each member of the family.

results.title: Menzies visits Malaya
results.brief_description: Records the welcome given to Sir Robert Menzies during his five day goodwill visit to Malaya in 1959. Shows Menzies swapping gifts with Tunku Abdul Rahman, visiting Parliament and reviewing Australian troops while Dame Pattie Menzies visits the hospital and speaks to the Women’s Institute. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Menzies in his time: Robert Gordon Menzies, 1894-1978
results.creator_credit: Steve Bowman Studio and Steve Bowman
results.brief_description: The program was produced to mark the centenary of Menzies’ birth and traces his political career and the changes which occured in Australia during his long leadership. The presentation uses archival material, personal home movies and photographs as well as newsreel and television footage spanning from the 1930’s to his death in 1978. A fascinating tribute to Australia’s longest serving Prime Minister.
